barker_notes.barker_summary: Josiah H. Bell to ——, May 17, 1832. Horse trading.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 772

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Josiah H. Bell to ——, May 17, 1832. Horse trading.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Colorado */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-17-1832">May 17th 1832?*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Sir*/p*
*p*I have this day sold your sorel Horse to *person_mentioned*Mrs Bucknor*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Powel*/person_mentioned* for five second rate mules as will be shown in the receipt for the note I also have in my possession a Horse belonging to those *person_mentioned*Gentlemen */person_mentioned*which I think to be worth twenty dollars should it suit you on your return to make any arangement with them satisfactory to yourself it will be good—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*J. H. Bell */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
